member.name: T:Blobject.Core.BlobClientBase
member.summary: An interface for interacting with different BLOB storage providers.

member.name: P:Blobject.Core.BlobClientBase.Logger
member.summary: Method to invoke to send log messages.

member.name: P:Blobject.Core.BlobClientBase.StreamBufferSize
member.summary: Buffer size to use when reading from a stream. Default is 65536.

member.name: M:Blobject.Core.BlobClientBase.ValidateConnectivity(System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.returns: True if connectivity can be established.

member.name: M:Blobject.Core.BlobClientBase.GetAsync(System.String,System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary: Gets the content of the BLOB with the specified key. For objects contained within subdirectories or folders, use the / character. For example, path/to/folder/myfile.txt
member.param: The key of the BLOB to get.
A cancellation token to observe while waiting for the task to complete.
member.returns: A byte array containing the content of the BLOB.

member.name: M:Blobject.Core.BlobClientBase.GetStreamAsync(System.String,System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary: Gets the stream of the BLOB with the specified key. For objects contained within subdirectories or folders, use the / character. For example, path/to/folder/myfile.txt
member.param: The key of the BLOB to get.
A cancellation token to observe while waiting for the task to complete.
member.returns: A object containing the stream of the BLOB.

member.name: M:Blobject.Core.BlobClientBase.GetMetadataAsync(System.String,System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary: Gets the metadata of the BLOB with the specified key. For objects contained within subdirectories or folders, use the / character. For example, path/to/folder/myfile.txt
member.param: The key of the BLOB to get metadata for.
A cancellation token to observe while waiting for the task to complete.
member.returns: A object containing the metadata of the BLOB.

member.name: M:Blobject.Core.BlobClientBase.WriteAsync(System.String,System.String,System.String,System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary: Writes the specified data to the BLOB with the specified key. For objects contained within subdirectories or folders, use the / character. For example, path/to/folder/myfile.txt To create a folder, have the key end in the / character, and send an empty string, an empty byte array, or an empty stream with zero content length.
member.param: The key of the BLOB to write to.
The content type of the BLOB.
The data to write to the BLOB.
A cancellation token to observe while waiting for the task to complete.

member.name: M:Blobject.Core.BlobClientBase.WriteAsync(System.String,System.String,System.Byte[],System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary: Writes the specified data to the BLOB with the specified key. For objects contained within subdirectories or folders, use the / character. For example, path/to/folder/myfile.txt To create a folder, have the key end in the / character, and send an empty string, an empty byte array, or an empty stream with zero content length.
member.param: The key of the BLOB to write to.
The content type of the BLOB.
The data to write to the BLOB.
A cancellation token to observe while waiting for the task to complete.

member.name: M:Blobject.Core.BlobClientBase.WriteAsync(System.String,System.String,System.Int64,System.IO.Stream,System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary: Writes the data from the specified stream to the BLOB with the specified key. For objects contained within subdirectories or folders, use the / character. For example, path/to/folder/myfile.txt To create a folder, have the key end in the / character, and send an empty string, an empty byte array, or an empty stream with zero content length.
member.param: The key of the BLOB to write to.
The content type of the BLOB.
The length of the content in the stream.
The stream containing the data to write to the BLOB.
A cancellation token to observe while waiting for the task to complete.

member.name: M:Blobject.Core.BlobClientBase.WriteManyAsync(System.Collections.Generic.List{Blobject.Core.WriteRequest},System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary: Writes many objects to the BLOB storage asynchronously. For objects contained within subdirectories or folders, use the / character. For example, path/to/folder/myfile.txt To create a folder, have the key end in the / character, and send an empty string, an empty byte array, or an empty stream with zero content length.
member.param: The list of objects to write to the BLOB storage.
member.returns: A task representing the asynchronous operation.

member.name: M:Blobject.Core.BlobClientBase.DeleteAsync(System.String,System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary: Deletes an object from the BLOB storage asynchronously. For objects contained within subdirectories or folders, use the / character. For example, path/to/folder/myfile.txt For file storage platforms, when deleting a folder, use / at the end of the key.
member.param: The key of the object to delete from the BLOB storage.
member.returns: A task representing the asynchronous operation.

member.name: M:Blobject.Core.BlobClientBase.ExistsAsync(System.String,System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary: Checks if an object with the specified key exists in the BLOB storage asynchronously. For objects contained within subdirectories or folders, use the / character. For example, path/to/folder/myfile.txt
member.param: The key of the object to check.
member.returns: A task representing the asynchronous operation. The task result is true if the object exists; otherwise, false.

member.name: M:Blobject.Core.BlobClientBase.GenerateUrl(System.String,System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary: Generates a URL to access the object with the specified key in the BLOB storage asynchronously. For objects contained within subdirectories or folders, use the / character. For example, path/to/folder/myfile.txt
member.param: The key of the object to generate the URL for.
member.returns: A string representing the URL to access the object.

member.name: M:Blobject.Core.BlobClientBase.Enumerate(Blobject.Core.EnumerationFilter)
member.summary: Enumerate all BLOBs within the repository. To enumerate only a specific prefix or contents of a specific folder, use the / character. For example, path/to/folder/myfile.txt

member.name: M:Blobject.Core.BlobClientBase.EnumerateAsync(Blobject.Core.EnumerationFilter,System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary: Enumerate all BLOBs within the repository asynchronously. To enumerate only a specific prefix or contents of a specific folder, use the / character. For example, path/to/folder/myfile.txt

member.name: M:Blobject.Core.BlobClientBase.EmptyAsync(System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary: WARNING: This API deletes all objects in the BLOB storage asynchronously recursively.
member.returns: A task representing the asynchronous operation.

member.name: P:Blobject.Core.BlobCopy.Logger
member.summary: Method to invoke to send log messages.

member.name: M:Blobject.Core.BlobCopy.#ctor(Blobject.Core.BlobClientBase,Blobject.Core.BlobClientBase,System.String)
member.param: Repository from which objects should be copied.
Repository to which objects should be copied.
Prefix of the objects that should be copied.

member.name: M:Blobject.Core.BlobCopy.Start(System.Int32,Blobject.Core.EnumerationFilter,System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.param: Stop after this many objects have been copied.

member.name: T:Blobject.Core.BlobData
member.summary: Contains content-length (how many bytes to read) and data stream for a given object.

member.name: P:Blobject.Core.BlobData.ContentLength
member.summary: Content-length of the object (how many bytes to read from Data).

member.name: P:Blobject.Core.BlobMetadata.IsFolder
member.summary: Boolean indicating if the BLOB is a folder.

member.name: P:Blobject.Core.BlobMetadata.CreatedUtc
member.summary: Timestamp from when the object was created.

member.name: P:Blobject.Core.BlobMetadata.LastUpdateUtc
member.summary: Timestamp from when the object was last updated, if available.

member.name: P:Blobject.Core.BlobMetadata.LastAccessUtc
member.summary: Timestamp from when the object was last accessed, if available.

member.name: M:Blobject.Core.BlobMetadata.ToString
member.summary: Create a human-readable string of the object.

member.name: M:Blobject.Core.Common.BytesToHexString(System.Byte[])
member.summary: Convert byte array to hex string.

member.name: M:Blobject.Core.Common.BytesFromHexString(System.String)
member.summary: Convert hex string to byte array.

member.name: M:Blobject.Core.Common.IsIpV4Address(System.String)
member.summary: Determine if a value is an IPv4 address.

member.name: M:Blobject.Core.Common.ResolveHostToIpV4Address(System.String)
member.summary: Resolve a hostname to an IPv4 address.

member.name: P:Blobject.Core.CopyStatistics.Success
member.summary: Flag indicating if the operation was successful.

member.name: M:Blobject.Core.CopyStatistics.ToString
member.summary: Produce a human-readable string representation of the object.

member.name: T:Blobject.Core.EmptyResult
member.summary: Results from a container empty operation.

member.name: P:Blobject.Core.EmptyResult.Bytes
member.summary: The total number of bytes represented by the BLOBs.

member.name: F:Blobject.Core.StorageTypeEnum.CIFS
member.summary: CIFS/SMB, e.g. Windows file share or SAMBA.

member.name: T:Blobject.Core.WriteRequest
member.summary: Write request object, used when writing many objects.

member.name: P:Blobject.Core.WriteRequest.ContentLength
member.summary: Content-length of the object (how many bytes to read from DataStream).
